intro: Leptorhynchos tetrachaetus var. penicillatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lepidote, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and finely divided, pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. This variety is noted for its distinctive leaf morphology and is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
